basics.name: Dennis Hartmann
basics.position: Research asisstant in quantum graivty and experimental XRay detectors
basics.summary: Mexican-born German (recently American) physics student interested in the quantum nature of gravity and working in the Penn State XRay detector astronomy lab

work.name: Institute for Gravitation and the Cosmos, Penn State University
work.position: PostBac Research assistant for Dr. Martin Bojowald
work.summary: Studying various approaches to quantum gravity such as causal dynamical triangulations (CDT), asymptotic safety, and studies of the covariance of models from loop quantum gravity (LQG)
highlights: Emergent Modified Gravity, CDT, Asymptotic Safety, LQG, LQC

work.name: Department of Astronomy and Astrophysics, Penn State University
work.position: PostBac Research assistant for Dr. Abe Falcone
work.summary: Various laboratory projects to aid in the calibration and characterization of XRay Hybrid CMOS detectors to be used for the NASA BlackCAT Mission
highlights: HCDS, Hybrid CMOS Detectors, NASA, BlackCAT, AGN

work.name: Institute for Gravitation and the Cosmos, Penn State University
work.position: Undergraduate Research assistant for Dr. Martin Bojowald
work.summary: Studied the emergent modified gravity (EMG) and how it can be used to study signature changes in the metric, and effect that should be present in loop quantum gravity, but possible on universal scale as proposed in our paper. Further studied casusal dynamical triangulations (CDT) using a Lorentzian signature
highlights: Emergent Modified Gravity, CDT, LQG, LQC

work.name: Institute for Gravitation and the Cosmos, Penn State University
work.position: Undergraduate Research assistant for Dr. Jackson Henry and Dr. Sarah Shandera
work.summary: Characterized the interactions between qubits in thermalizing open quantum systems by understanding properties such as their connectivities

work.name: Laboratory for Research on the Structure of Matter, University of Pennsylvania
work.position: NSF REU student for Dr. Andrea Liu

work.name: Department of Mathematics, Penn State University
work.position: Undergraduate Research assistant for Dr. Toan Nguyen
highlights: Quantum Many Body Systems, Hamiltonian Dynamics

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: David Bohm Award
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
